titleStmt.title: Charles by the grace of God, King of Great Britaine ... forsamekle as by an act and proclamation made and published heeretofore, and bearing date the sixteene day of Iulij last ...
titleStmt.author: Scotland. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A11695 of text S2317 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 21980). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 6 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 1 1-bit group-IV TIFF page image.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: Charles by the grace of God, King of Great Britaine ... forsamekle as by an act and proclamation made and published heeretofore, and bearing date the sixteene day of Iulij last ...
titleStmt.author: Scotland. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

notesStmt.note: At head of title: God saue the King.
Second pt. of title from text.
Date of imprint suggested by STC (2nd ed.).
"Giuen vnder our signet at Haly-rud-house the eight daye of August and of our raigne the fourth yeare. 1628."
Reproduction of original in the Town House (Aberdeen, Scotland). Charter Room.
